titleInfo.title: Elk’s Club Lodge House being razed for new construction on Sixth Avenue N, Nashville, Tennessee, 1971 June 16

mods.identifier: RG 3 763 Elk's Club Being Razed for New Construction001

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: A view of the razing of the Elk’s Club Lodge no. 72, located at 310 6th Avenue North in downtown Nashville, Tennessee, June 16th, 1971. Originally one of downtown Nashville’s many 19th century residential mansions, the structure was torn down to make room for the James K. Polk State Office Building and the Tennessee Performing Arts Center. The Lodge was home to the Elks, beginning in 1904, serving numerous community functions and charity projects for the next several decades. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 color filmstrip negative.

titleInfo.title: Record Group 3 Metro Davidson County Photographer
